moves.1... e5: allowing white to set up the gambit if he desires
moves.3... Qh4+: i know people are gonna disagree but this move does nothing for black, at best it makes the game even, but usally white gains an advantage.
moves.5. Nf3: attacks the queen and guards the pawn indirectly
moves.5... Qg4: not the place to put the queen, well now for a trap.
moves.6. Bxf7+: he must allow me this pawn and walk away, if he takes the bishop the following happens
moves.7... Ke6 8. Nxg4: this game is already very bad for black now just got to mate that king
moves.9... d5: well developing was a better idea for you.
moves.10. e5: ill just move it here and attack your knight
moves.12... Kg5 13. Nxd5: the king is already in a corner almost
moves.14. Qd2 Bc5 15. Qxf4+: this check gave me 5 different mates i preset them all and left the game alone
moves.15... Kh4: this was the longest of the 5 so he picked the one giving me the most options for mistakes
moves.16. g3+ Kh3: i liked h5 better it made him last longer and it gave me a way to mess up.
moves.17. Qh6+: nothing left but to block needlessy with the bishop
moves.17... Bh5: i could be cute and mate with kf4 # but i went the traditional way instead.
moves.18. Qxh5#: a surprising game when he was higher rated then i was
